left.name: Equality
left.description: Those with higher Equality scores believe that everyone should be viewed equally and tend to have an impartial perception of others, where they may be against treating anyone differently due to specfic judgements.

right.name: Discrimination
right.description: Those with higher Discrimination scores believe in valuing some more than others. They tend to be in favor of exclusion and separate treatment, oftentimes even based on matters of identity or unchangeable characteristics.

left.name: Bioequalism
left.description: If you have a higher Bioequal score, you belive in treating Animals/Extraterrestrials less harshly or the same as humans. You most likely think a lot of modern practices are harmful and need to be outlawed in favor of something more ethical.

right.name: Speciesism
right.description: If you have a higher Speciesist score, then you're in favor of one speciesâ€™ supremacy (Most likely humans.) You belive other animals are inferior to one species, and are below and used for the gains of the higher species.

left.name: World Federalism
left.description: Those with higher World Federalism scores believe in a united world without the constructs of nations for people to separated or filtered into.

right.name: Ultranationalism
right.description: Those with higher Ultranationalism scores believe in concept of nationhood, belonging to nation. As such, they oppose a cooperative global network, even opposing all kinds of outside interference, aiming to squash all things foreign.

left.name: Democracy
left.description: If you have a higher Democratic score, then you're more in favor of people being able to control the laws of the land according to their needs.

right.name: Totality
right.description: If you have a higher Totality score, then you're more in favor of a single person/government entity making the laws, with little to no say given to the people.

left.name: Liberty
left.description: If you have a higher Liberty score, then you are in favor of individual freedom, not being controlled by any government entity. You most likely are in favor of victimless crimes being legalized, freedom of speech and opinion, on and on.

right.name: Limited
right.description: If you have a higher Limited score, then you believe that individual liberties need to be restricted, and in the extreme cases, totally controlled by the government.

left.name: Tolerance
left.description: If you have a higher Tolerance score, then you believe in being more Tolerance and open to different beliefs, wanting to keep diverse beliefs in the public as much as possible.

right.name: Ignorance
right.description: If you have a higher Ignorance score, then you don't often listen to or don't want there to be external beliefs. You're more in favor of an Echo Chamber, and you want Ideological dissenters gone and dealt with.

left.name: Secular
left.description: If you have a higher Secular score, then you are in favor of a Religion-Free government, advocating for a government that can equally represent all religious and non-religious people equally.

right.name: Theocratic
right.description: If you have a higher Theocratic score, then you're more in favor of a Religious/Atheist government, with that belief being the dominant one in all government decisions.

left.name: Hexarchy
left.description: If you have a higher Hexarchic score, then you belive that more leader would be beneficial to a society, rather than one or two.

right.name: Monoarchy
right.description: Not to be confused with Monarchy, if you have a higher Monoarchic score, then you are more in favor of less or one single leader leading society rather than many.

left.name: Environmental
left.description: If you have a higher Environmental score, then you believe that the environment should be protected and taken care of, rather than exploited for human gain.

right.name: Pollutionist
right.description: If you have a higher Pollutionist score, then you're more in favor of damaging the environment in favor of human needs, rather than spending time to care for it.
